oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter.date
Class OsnDateLocalConverter

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter.OsnFieldValueConverter
      oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter.date.OsnBaseDateValueConverter
          oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.oaext.osn.publicutil.converter.date.OsnDateLocalConverter

public class OsnDateLocalConverter
extends OsnBaseDateValueConverter

A converter for the Date Local Gadget type which can be used to take a Date/Time value in a specific timezone and convert it to be the same Date/Time value but in the UTC timezone. For example: Original Value:  02/10/2014 10:20AM PST Converted Value:  02/10/2014 10:20AM UTC

This converter will accept Date/Times in the following types (and subclasses):

  • java.lang.Number - This will be converted into a long value.
  • java.util.Date - This covers java.util.Date and java.util.TimeStamp.
  • oracle.jbo.domain.Date
  • oracle.jbo.domain.Timestamp

By default the TimeZone of the date passed in will be assumed to be the servers TimeZone (TimeZone.getDefault()). If this is not the case then set the Time Zone ID of the date using the setTimeZone method. Refer to the Java Time Zone class for information about the Time Zone ID.

There are two types of conversion that can occur which are accessed via the getConversionType/setConversionType:

  • dateonly - Only convert the date portion of the value passed in.
  • datetime - Convert both the date and time portions of the value passed in.

Since:
11.1.1.7.3

Method Detail

convertDate

protected long convertDate(java.lang.Object initialValue,
                           OsnConversionContext context)
                    throws OsnConversionException
The implementation of the date conversion routine. If an issue occurs during the conversion meaning that the date conversion cannot succeed then a OsnConversionException should be thrown.

Converts the date provided into UTC time zone with the same date/time for the Date Local gadget conversion.

Specified by:
convertDate in class OsnBaseDateValueConverter
Parameters:
initialValue - the value to convert.
context - additional data that is useful during the conversion.
Returns:
the converted value.
Throws:
OsnConversionException - thrown if initialValue == null or is not one of the Java types that convertDate can support (see class heading comments).

getConversionType

public final java.lang.String getConversionType()
Get the type of conversion that is to occur.
  • dateonly - only convert the day-month-year portion of the date into UTC
  • datetime - convert the entire date to UTC

Returns:
convertionType dateonly/datetime.
